translated: The Collection of Groups of Ones

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, said by the Arahant, so I have heard:

original: “Ekadhammaṁ atītassa, bhikkhave, purisapuggalassa nāhaṁ tassa kiñci pāpakammaṁ akaraṇīyanti vadāmi.
analyzed: eka dhammam atītassa bhikkhave purisa puggalassa na aham tassa kiñci pāpa kammam a karaṇīyam ti vadāmi
translated: “Monks, I don’t say that for a person who has gone beyond one thing, there is no bad kamma to be done.

analyzed: yat idam bhikkhave sampajāna musāvādaḥ ti

translated: And in connection with this, it was said:
“For a person who has gone beyond one thing,🔽a liar,
who has crossed over the world beyond—
there’s no bad kamma that can’t be done.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
